name: Amber Sands Beach Resort

reviews.title: Wonderful Place
reviews.text: We spent two nights at Amber Sands, and it was wonderful. The resort is located on the east side of the island meaning it is less populated and busy, and about a kilometer from the Centre Point ferry station. Great for relaxing and unwinding which is exactly what we wanted. The owners Julian and Cheryl will help sign you up for any kind of tour you would like. We rented a scooter for a day and drove around looking at things on our own pace. The private cabana was wonderful as well. If we ever make it back to Ko Change we will stay at Amber Sands. The restaurant there is pretty tasty as well serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I would have like a little seafood on the menu, but that is the only negative (and a small one at that) I can think of.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Amber Sands for a few nights in November 2009 on the back of the reviews written on trip advisor. First impressions were disappointing as the resort is located close to the main road. We quickly discovered the resort is on the wrong side of the Island as the beach is poor and the water is marred with diesel fuel from the nearby ferries.
reviews.title: Wrong side of Koh Chang

reviews.text: The family atmosphere may suit some travellers, but we found it claustrophic and not suited to a young couple. They undoubtly go out of their way to welcome families however if you don't fulfil this criteria there are far better options. In fact we felt that Koh Chang has been spoilt by over development, making the effort to travel to Koh Mak or Koh Kood is a much better option as you will get a true Thai Island experience.
reviews.title: Funky hut- Amber sand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came in feb 2009 for a few days after a great mail talking with Julian Cowburn.
reviews.title: Relaxing location, lovely hosts, beautiful rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had really good time in this place , friendly and helpfull staff and good food .
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Amber Sands for 3 nights in Dec 09 en route to Koh Kood, flying in to Trat with Bangkok Airways. We arranged the bus/ferry transfer at the airport with Bangkok Airways' shuttle which was very efficient and easy.
reviews.title: Very friendly small hotel on tranquil east coast of Koh Chang

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is on the quiet east coast of Koh Chang, a quite developed island near Cambodia. The resort's beach is narrow and has orange 'amber' sand rather than the white sand of the west coast. The sea is not as clear and the sea bed a bit rocky but very swimmable. The hotel is right on the beach with individual villas and an average sized swimming pool. There is a hotel kayak to borrow when you feel like it at no cost. The grounds are very well kept with different plants and flowers. Rooms are quite basic but comfortable and a good size, with quiet a/c and fan. The open air restaurant located right on the beach had a good selection of delicious and reasonable thai and western food. There are no other restaurants/resorts nearby so unless you have transport you have to eat here. We enjoyed all our food very much for 3 days here, and we like good food. Breakfasts could be cooked to order but we had fresh fruit and muesli and yogurt. There was free internet on the PC in the restaurnat area and books and magazines to borrow. Julian and Cheryl Cowburn, the owners, were extremely hospitable, friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had a relaxing stay. Even in a small hotel such as this we never felt they were imposing or 'claustrophobic', and we are 2 people that like to keep ourselves to ourselves on holiday. They offered lifts to White Sands beach and then drove us there to get our transfer songtaew to Koh Kood island on our last morning when other hoteliers would have made us get a taxi. We paid £35 a night which we considered to be great value for peak season. The hotel is not super-luxurious but laid back, friendly, well kept and comfortable with really delicious food.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a quiet, relaxing jumping-off point

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Amber Sands for three nights after many crazy days of travel around Thailand and Cambodia. It was exactly what we needed. Amber Sands is close to the ferry station and the main road, but is quiet, extremely clean, and is beautifully situated on the east side of island. It's a fabulous place to stay if you want quiet and out-of-the-way. If you want night life, choices of restaurants, and amazing beaches, then stay elsewhere. But if you don't mind gorgeous cabanas, delicious meals at the resort restaurant, stunning views of the mainland, and a friendly staff then you've found your place.
reviews.title: It doesn't get better than this!

reviews.text: We chose this place specifically because it was on the less populous side of the island. We rented a scooter, hiked to several waterfalls, and made our way (down crazy roads) to Long Beach. Do make it to that beach. We about had the place to ourselves and it was gorgeous!
reviews.title: Relax Between Two Worlds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Julian, Cheryl, and family went out of their way to be friendly and accommodating. They have a little slice of paradise and we're thankful to have shared in it for a few days!
reviews.title: Paradise Found

reviews.text: We have stayed in many areas of Thailand and in many places over the last 9 years. This is the only accommodation that actually is better than it looks on the web. The gardens and views are beautiful, there is a great deal of attention to detail and a lot of hard work goes into making the gardens lovely and this attracts some of the most beautiful and big butterflies. Our accommodation was beautifully clean and very spacious and the only place we have stayed with really good sized wardrobes and coat hangers!!! (not something we have had at other places)
reviews.title: An absolutely beautiful & peaceful place to stay with people who are friendly and make you feel like one of the family.

reviews.text: The whole family made us feel so welcome that we left feeling we really had made some great friends and if we lived closer would definately see them more often.
reviews.title: Upset to leave....

reviews.text: With having two young children , a husband with a bad back and quite a bit of heavy luggage we were worried about the transfer from the plane, ferry and by taxi to the resort. This was so easy though, we were met from the plane and we and our luggage were taken straight to the ferry a short drive away, our luggage was lifted into a taxi at the other end and after 5 minutes we arrived at Amber Sands.
reviews.title: ...a beautiful and welcoming oasis of relaxation...

reviews.text: We were also worried about how the children would cope with it being more of a quieter holiday than usual and they said it was the best holiday they ever had. Our 10 year old son really loved swimming in the day and playing games at night that were available - the things we often don't have time to do at home.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.text: We stayed on this side of the island for 12 days and wish we had stayed longer. We hired a car and went on some lovely trips.
reviews.title: a perfect place to begin your holiday on Ko Chang island

reviews.text: When we prepared our holiday we sent an email off to Julian (The proprietor) asking a few questions. As this was the first time we have travelled with a little baby. Julian's responses were just great and so informative of the Island. They even arranged some nappies so we didn’t have fill our bags with them. The service was unbelievable from the first email to our departure.
reviews.title: This is an amazing place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival at Amber Sands we were just amazed to see how beautiful this place was. If you think it looks great on the web then seeing it with your own eyes makes it even better. . The rooms and decor are even better than the website photos. We where lucky enough to seen a full moon when the bay lights up and glows like something I never seen before just looked so beautiful. The family is just so lovely and accommodating. Cheryl makes a great Nanny while we ate in the restaurant. Deon can sure make a great cocktail. The menu was good and reasonably priced. So what makes Amber Sands one of the best places I have ever stayed at? Is it the rooms and the attention to detail, Is it the lovely gardens, Is it the amazing flora & fauna, Is it the swimming pool over looking the stunning bay, Is it the great ambience at night with the soft lighting, Or the full moon that makes the bay shine like a diamond, Is it the great family service, Is it the friendly local staff. You will just have to visit and check this place out for yourself. A truly unbelievable place to stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Peace, Tranquillity, Atmosphere, Hospitality, Good Food, Excellent Value

aka: Amber Sands Beach Hotel Koh Chang
description: Experience peace on Koh Chang's tranquil east coast in our small, family run resort metres from a quiet, almost deserted beach where we bring you a personal, individual experience. Only eight spacious air-conditioned bungalows, set in a tropical garden, all with views of the beach. Our fresh water pool provides an alternative. The thatch roof open-sided restaurant is steps from the beach and offers both traditional Thai dishes and a range of Western foods.
